title: DC'd for the first time ever for 5 minutes, I get leaverbuster penalty for 100 minutes???
body:
What the hell kind of system did you monkeys implement now?

I DC'd for 5 minutes due to technical problems - my game bugsplat, and then when I rejoined I had extremely low FPS, so I had to restart my computer. When I finished the game, I got a message from LeaverBuster telling me that due to "consistent AFK behaviour", I was being punished with a 20 minute wait before my next 5 games. Is this a joke? This is the first time ever I have received such a message or warning, and the FIRST ROUND of penalty is a 20 fucking minute wait before each game?

replies.body:
Bull%%%%.

I've had several leaves in the new leaver buster, and i'm still yet to get anything.

Oh one example, well wrap it up everyone this guy has put in the necessary research to reach a logical conclusion.

Seriously though if that's how you normally think, just don't bother ever sharing your opinion with anyone, it's worthless.

Looking for a Rioter to address this issue, it's clear many other people are having the same problem.

If it was ranked (looking at your match history, it probably was) leaver buster is even harsher. It only takes 1 5minute ranked dc and it is low priority que for you. 
**Reason: **Ranked is competitive and even a 5 minute disconnect is enough to completely change a game (being unfair to teammates etc) . Riot wants to dissuade players from ruining the experiences of others by playing ranked on unstable connections. Unfortunately, leaver buster is an automated coding and can't detect the reason behind your dc, whether it be bugsplat, client restart due to issues, or a real life emergency and you will be punished just like everyone else.

I think it's a mistake to think of it just as a punishment. Effectively, you have been told to prove that whatever problem caused you to go AFK is a one time deal. Riot wants to know you can keep a connection and not go AFK for 20 minutes to reassure them that your next game won't be ruined the same way. Do that five times without causing any more problems, and Riot is satisfied.

And if it *isn't* a one time deal, it stops some guy ruining everybody's fun just because he refuses to acknowledge that his computer or his circumstances aren't up to the task.
